GOD.content: the 2 economies of salary [Christianity]: retribution (exchange), and love of foreigner; latter an interruption, an exceeding of the economy of the community, of Schmitt’s strict politics, interrupts self-consciousness, inaugurates exchange

H.content: madness, in Sophist, of the “foreign son,” parricide by a stranger

H.content: Socrates has characteristics of a foreigner [see p. 19]

H.content: at what point is a foreigner no longer foreign?

H.content: foreigner vs. barbarian (absolutely other does not have a name or family name)

H.content: question posed to the foreigner: “what is your name?”

H.content: Klossowski: stranger on the horizon like a liberator

H.content: we let ourselves be interrogated by certain figures of the foreigner, “what?” “who?”
H.linkedContent: we let ourselves be interrogated by certain figures of the foreigner, “what?” “who?”

H.content: question of foreigner, question of response and responsibility

SPOM.content: “absolute proximity of a stranger whose power is singular and anonymous (es spukt),” unnameable, neutral power > this, which we have said nothing determinable urgently returns, insists, gives one to think, irresistible anguish, like that of future and death, doesn’t stem from but produces automatism of repetition alongside principle of reason > tout autre est tout autre

POOF.content: if no appurtenance in friendship, why call this foreigner (absolute foreigner) my friend? no appeasing response to this question
POOF.linkedContent: if no appurtenance in friendship, why call this foreigner (absolute foreigner) my friend? no appeasing response to this question

HERP.content: foreign language, we know it could be intelligible, bears on beings beside which Dasein can stand, friend as stranger must belong to a Volk, engaged in a history, Mitgeschehen
HERP.linkedContent: foreign language, we know it could be intelligible, bears on beings beside which Dasein can stand, friend as stranger must belong to a Volk, engaged in a history, Mitgeschehen

MPM.content: to lose one’s language in a foreign place is the terrible chance of the promise
MPM.linkedContent: to lose one’s language in a foreign place is the terrible chance of the promise

VM.content: via Levinas, Eleatic Stranger, disciple of Parmenides, avait dû lui donner raison pour avoir raison de lui: pliant le non-être à être [other only in contrast to Being]

OH.content: integrate immigrant, recognize and accept alterity of immigrant: 2 concepts of hospitality

S.content: Heidegger interprets der Wahnsinnige in Trakl to mean that the stranger is on the way to elsewhere (as madness, de-ceased, toward the unborn, Artaud’s in-nate)—like a revenant, Derrida adds [p. 92 journey, Abgeschiedenheit of stranger]

F.content: crypt (foreigner in self) & the ghost effect (heterocryptic ghost returning from Unconscious of the other) > radical otherness in self (not unconscious) > law of another generation
F.linkedContent: crypt (foreigner in self) & the ghost effect (heterocryptic ghost returning from Unconscious of the other) > radical otherness in self (not unconscious) > law of another generation

FWT.content: successful mourning is failed mourning, is unfaithful: denies alterity of dead other, of death as other > same goes for integration of immigrant/foreigner
FWT.linkedContent: successful mourning is failed mourning, is unfaithful: denies alterity of dead other, of death as other > same goes for integration of immigrant/foreigner

FWT.linkedContent: faithfulness prescribes impossibility of mourning at once [St. Augustine’s “I live on for my friend” in POOF]

DPi.content: unbelieving, atheistic, skeptical, nominalist > a stranger to everything

Gii.content: via Heidegger, German fremd relates to High German fram, underway toward, toward elsewhere, toward “encounter w/ what is reserved for it in advance (dem Voraufbehaltenen entgegen)” > allows one to say: stranger does not wander (erre), is not w/out destination; Derrida compares this to Latin extraneus, outside of, extra

BSi.content: unheimlich: 1) worrying aspect of foreignness as intimacy of one’s own home 2) says the essential bearing of Celan’s “Meridian” 3) associated w/ the foreigner 4) Geheimnis (the intimate, the folded back on itself, what has withdrawn in withdrawal, hidden inside of house and home), secret of encounter at most intimate heart of present
